header.title: Research And Development Analytics
header.desc: Share, organize, and discover R&D results faster with Plotly's collaborative analytics platform. Share experiment and analysis results from Excel, MATLAB, R, and Python to technical and non-technical company stakeholders alike.

sections.title: Plotly helps make research workflow more efficient by:
sections.body:
1. Providing an intuitive chart creation and editing web application, saving time spent editing and styling graphs created programatically with Python/MATLAB/R or Excel;

2. Centralizing data, graphs, and analyses across an organization;

3. Providing advanced image export capabilities; and

4. Making results easily accessible to technical and non-technical audiences through Plotly's Cloud.

Chart
Grondo

sections.title: Automating HTML reports of sensor data
sections.body: The Advanced Technologies and Projects team at Google uses Plotly Enterprise with IPython notebook to automatically generate reports of Plotly graphs. The HTML reports are emailed to company executives, who open the report graphs in Plotly Enterprise for further exploration and pdf download. GENERATE HTML REPORTS WITH PYTHON, PANDAS, AND PLOTLY

sections.title: Liquid metal batteries for utility-scale storage
sections.body: Ambri uses Plotly Enterprise with Research Box to develop new chemistries and cell materials for its liquid metal batteries. The business development team uses Plotly with RStudio and Excel to generate client cost saving curves for Ambri commercial deployments.

sections.title: Collaboration and institutional memory for IPython notebook
sections.body:
Dr. Pekka's team at VTT Finland uses IPython notebook and Plotly to share data and build institutional memory within the research group. The creator of IPython sits on Plotly's advisory board and helps steer Plotly's Python client development.
VTT CASE STUDY

sections.title: Quantum computing research
sections.body:
The Center for Quantum Devices at the University of Copenhagen uses Plotly for instrumentation dashboards and ad-hoc graphing inside IPython Notebooks.
BAND DIAGRAMS WITH PLOTLY AND PYTHON

sections.title: Autonomous, underwater robot R&D
sections.body:
Blue Robotics uses Plotly with Excel and Python to graph the motor performance results of their underwater robots.
PLOTLY GRAPHS ON BLUE ROBOTICS BLOG

sections.title: Plotly for research at NYU
sections.body: New York University has a site-license of Plotly Enterprise available to its research labs, classrooms and faculty at graphs.nyu.edu.
